member.name: M:Calendar.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.summary: Name of the event

member.summary: Location of the event

member.summary: Notes of the event

member.summary: Start Date of the event

member.name: P:Calendar.Models.EventBaseModel.EndDate
member.summary: End Date of the event

member.name: P:Calendar.Models.EventBaseModel.Recurrent
member.summary:
Indicates if the event is recurrent (has repetitions in the future).
When an event is not recurrent FrequencyRule, Frequency, EndBy, DayOfWeek and OrdinalDayOfWeek properties are ignored.
When an event is recurrent the API calculates the repetitions of such event based on a FrequencyRule. It stars to itarate from StartDate until EndBy and creates a list of EventRepetition. Quartz library is used to accomplished this purpose.
More info: Quartz.NET - Quartz Enterprise Scheduler.NET

member.name: P:Calendar.Models.EventBindingModel.EndBy
member.summary: This is the end date for the repetitions when the event is recurrent. The iterator to generate repetitions will go on until it exceeds this date

member.name: P:Calendar.Models.EventBindingModel.FrequencyRule
member.summary:
Indicates the frequency rule used to calculate future repetitions. It's mandatory when the event is recurrent
1 - WEEKLY
The event is repeated weekly (Frequency=1) or every certain weeks (Frenquency=n). When using this rule DayOfWeek property must be specified
Example 1: Every Wednesday
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 1
"Frequency": 1
"DayOfWeek":3
Example 2: Every other Tuesday
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 1
"Frequency": 2
"DayOfWeek":2
---------------------------------
2 - MONTHLY EVERY DAY OF THE MONTH
The event is repeated every day of a month, every month (Frequency=1) or every certain months (Frenquency=n). The day and day time are taken from StarDate property
Example 1: Every 5th of every month at 1 pm
"StarDate": "2016-09-05T13:00:00"
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 2
"Frequency": 1
Example 2: Every 15th of the month, every 3 months
"StarDate": "2016-09-15"
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 1
"Frequency": 3
---------------------------------
3 - MONTHLY EVERY DAY OF THE WEEK
The event is repeated every specific day of the week, every month (Frequency=1) or every certain months (Frenquency=n). When using this rule DayOfWeek and OrdinalDayOfTheWeek properties must be specified.
Example 1: The first Tuesday of every month
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 3
"Frequency": 1
"DayOfWeek": 2
"OrdinalDayOfTheWeek": 1
Example 2: The last Saturday of every month
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 3
"Frequency": 1
"DayOfWeek": 6
"OrdinalDayOfTheWeek": 6
Example 3: The 2nd Friday of the month, every 3 months
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 3
"Frequency": 3
"DayOfWeek": 5
"OrdinalDayOfTheWeek": 2
---------------------------------
4 - ANUALLY EVERY DAY OF THE MONTH
The event is repeated every day of a month, every year (Frequency=1) or every certain years (Frenquency=n). The month, day and day time are taken from StarDate property
Example 1: The 23rd of February every year
"StarDate": "2016-02-23"
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 4
"Frequency": 1
Example 2: Every 15th of April at 9 am, every 2 years
"StarDate": "2016-04-15T09:00:00"
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 1
"Frequency": 2
---------------------------------
5 - ANUALLY EVERY DAY OF THE WEEK
The event is repeated every specific day of the week, every year (Frequency=1) or every certain years (Frenquency=n). When using this rule DayOfWeek and OrdinalDayOfTheWeek properties must be specified. The month is taken from StartDate month
Example 1: The third Tuesday in February every year
"StarDate": "2016-02-28"
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 5
"Frequency": 1
"DayOfWeek": 2
"OrdinalDayOfTheWeek": 3
Example 2: The last Thurday in November, every 3 years
"StarDate": "2016-11-01"
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 5
"Frequency": 3
"DayOfWeek": 4
"OrdinalDayOfTheWeek": 6

member.name: P:Calendar.Models.EventBindingModel.Frequency
member.summary:
Frequency in which repetitions will be generated. If it's not specified it assumes 1 by default
Exmaple 1: if the FrequencyRule=1 (WEEKLY) and Frequency=2 means that the event is repeated every 2 weeks
Exmaple 2: if the FrequencyRule=3 (MONTHLY EVERY DAY OF THE MONTH) and Frequency=6 means that the event is repeated every 6 months
Exmaple 3: if the FrequencyRule=4 (ANUALLY EVERY DAY OF THE MONTH) and Frequency=3 means that the event is repeated every 3 years

member.name: P:Calendar.Models.EventBindingModel.DayOfWeek
member.summary:
Indicates the day of the week when the frequency rule is WEEKLY, MONTHLY EVERY DAY OF THE WEEK or ANUALLY EVERY DAY OF THE WEEK. Values:
0 = Sunday
1 = Monday
2 = Tuesday
3 = Wednesday
4 = Thursday
5 = Friday
6 = Saturday

member.name: P:Calendar.Models.EventBindingModel.OrdinalDayOfTheWeek
member.summary:
Indicates ordinal day of week within a month when the frequency rule is MONTHLY EVERY DAY OF THE WEEK or ANUALLY EVERY DAY OF THE WEEK. Values:
1 = First day of week
2 = Second day of week
3 = Third day of week
4 = Fourth day of week
5 = Fifth day of week
6 = Last day of week
Example 1: fist Tuesday of the month
"DayOfWeek":2,
"OrdinalDayOfTheWeek":1
Example 2: last Monday of the month
"DayOfWeek":1,
"OrdinalDayOfTheWeek":6
Example 3: third Friday of the month
"DayOfWeek":5,
"OrdinalDayOfTheWeek":3

member.name: P:Calendar.Models.EventViewModel.EventID
member.summary: Unique number that identifies the event. This property is ignored in the creation of a new event

member.name: P:Calendar.Models.EventViewModel.UserID
member.summary: Unique identifier of the user

member.name: P:Calendar.Models.EventViewModel.EndBy
member.summary: This is the end date for the repetitions when the event is recurrent. The iterator to generate repetitions will go on until it exceeds this date

member.name: P:Calendar.Models.EventViewModel.FrequencyRule
member.summary:
Indicates the frequency rule used to calculate future repetitions. It's mandatory when the event is recurrent
1 - WEEKLY
The event is repeated weekly (Frequency=1) or every certain weeks (Frenquency=n). When using this rule DayOfWeek property must be specified
Example 1: Every Wednesday
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 1
"Frequency": 1
"DayOfWeek":3
Example 2: Every other Tuesday
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 1
"Frequency": 2
"DayOfWeek":2
---------------------------------
2 - MONTHLY EVERY DAY OF THE MONTH
The event is repeated every day of a month, every month (Frequency=1) or every certain months (Frenquency=n). The day and day time are taken from StarDate property
Example 1: Every 5th of every month at 1 pm

"Recurrent": true

Example 2: Every 15th of the month, every 3 months
"StarDate": "2016-09-15"
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 1
"Frequency": 3

The event is repeated every specific day of the week, every month (Frequency=1) or every certain months (Frenquency=n). When using this rule DayOfWeek and OrdinalDayOfTheWeek properties must be specified.
Example 1: The first Tuesday of every month
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 3
"Frequency": 1
"DayOfWeek": 2
"OrdinalDayOfTheWeek": 1
Example 2: The last Saturday of every month
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 3
"Frequency": 1
"DayOfWeek": 6
"OrdinalDayOfTheWeek": 6
Example 3: The 2nd Friday of the month, every 3 months

---------------------------------
4 - ANUALLY EVERY DAY OF THE MONTH
The event is repeated every day of a month, every year (Frequency=1) or every certain years (Frenquency=n). The month, day and day time are taken from StarDate property
Example 1: The 23rd of February every year
"StarDate": "2016-02-23"
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 4
"Frequency": 1
Example 2: Every 15th of April at 9 am, every 2 years
"StarDate": "2016-04-15T09:00:00"
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 1
"Frequency": 2
---------------------------------
5 - ANUALLY EVERY DAY OF THE WEEK
The event is repeated every specific day of the week, every year (Frequency=1) or every certain years (Frenquency=n). When using this rule DayOfWeek and OrdinalDayOfTheWeek properties must be specified. The month is taken from StartDate month
Example 1: The third Tuesday in February every year
"StarDate": "2016-02-28"
"Recurrent": true
"FrequencyRule": 5
"Frequency": 1
"DayOfWeek": 2
"OrdinalDayOfTheWeek": 3
Example 2: The last Thurday in November, every 3 years
"StarDate": "2016-11-01"
"Recurrent": true

"Frequency": 3
"DayOfWeek": 4
"OrdinalDayOfTheWeek": 6

Frequency in which repetitions will be generated. If it's not specified it assumes 1 by default

Example 3: third Friday of the month

member.name: P:Calendar.Models.EventViewModel.CronExpression
member.summary:
Cron expression used for calculating event repetitions. This expression is calculated automatically in the creation event.This format is supported by Quartz library and may be useful for rendering events in a web calendar
More info:
Quartz documentation: Quartz.NET - Quartz Enterprise Scheduler.NET
Cron expression maker: Cron Maker

member.name: P:Calendar.Models.EventViewModel.Repetitions
member.summary:
A list of event repetitions which consists of a duple StartDate and EndDate which are created based on the duration time of the event (EndDate minus StartDate).
For example, if an event is recurrent every week, StarDate="2016-09-05T13:00:00" and EndDate="2016-09-05T15:00:00" the event repetitions will be {StarDate="2016-09-12T13:00:00", EndDate="2016-09-12T15:00:00"}, {StarDate="2016-09-19T13:00:00", EndDate="2016-09-19T15:00:00"}, etc...
Look how day time (hour, minutes, seconds) is kept in each repetition.
